title: Viacom Chief Downplays Volatility of Media Stock
text:
Get Business & Technology Alerts 
18 Sep 2015 02:10 AM EST 
Philippe Dauman, president and CEO of Viacom, downplayed concerns over the company’s stock price Wednesday at a conference for senior broadcasting executives in the U.K. saying: “You have to look through… People start awfulizing very easily, and they extrapolate trends as occurring very rapidly. They assume that content companies that have been in business a very long time and have adapted over a very long time are not going to adapt. So there are a lot of assumption built in." Dauman emphasized the importance of international markets, with a focus on the U.K., where Viacom bought free-to-air broadcaster Channel 5 a year ago, India and Africa, later adding: “The trend is clear – the revenue models that are being challenged in the U.S. will also come under increasing pressure here as the digital revolution continues to transform viewing habits.”
